verse:
त्वामीश्वरं स्वाश्रयमात्ममायया विनिर्मिताशेषविशेषकल्पनम् ।
क्रीडार्थमद्यात्तमनुष्यविग्रहं नतोऽस्मि धुर्यं यदुवृष्णिसात्वताम् ॥

terms.yadu-patim: to the chief of the Yadus

vedabase.translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Having thus addressed Lord Kṛṣṇa, the chief of the Yadu dynasty, Nārada bowed down and offered Him obeisances. Then that great sage and most eminent devotee took his leave from the Lord and went away, feeling great joy at having directly seen Him.

terms.यदुवृष्णिसात्वताम्: among the Yadus and Satvatas (referring to Lord Krishna)
terms.You, the Supreme Lord, are self: created and sheltered in yourself with the power of your own divine maya (illusion). You manifest various special forms for the purpose of play. I bow down to you, the one who assumed a human form among the Yadus and Satvatas, and I am honored to carry your praises.

bard.meaning: Śrī Śuka said: Thus the brahmin of great spiritual power, venerating the Lord of the Yadus, Krishna, obtained permission to depart and went in great joy at having seen the Lord.
